page.title: 17CHALFONT ST GILES CHURCH
page.content: ST Giles'Church,which stands behind the houses surrounding the village green ,is an old stone and flint build- ing,the nave dating from the 12th cent- ury.It is reached through a lych gate. Inside the church,the chancel and the octagonal font are 13th century,while the beautifully carved pews are 14th. There are some rare mediaeval wall paintings which were discovered under whitewash when the church was renovated in the 1920s.There are many Masons Marks which were the 'signatures' of the craftsmen who built the church.The original six bells were recently augmented to eight.Above the south porch is a wood carving of St Giles, patron saint of lepers,cripples and blacksmiths.
